results.title: Diana: story of a princess
results.creator_credit: Nick Ward, Phil Craig, Sally Brindle, Janice Sutherland and Brook Lapping Productions
results.brief_description: This four part television series is adapted from the book of the same name, retracing the life and mixed fortunes of Diana, Princess of Wales. The four part series features extensive interviews including: Diana’s staff, the press, royal biographers, photographers, friends, lovers, former colleagues as well as James Hewitt, Trevor Rhys-Jones and numerous people that Diana had met on tour. The documentary uses fictional “recreations” of certain scenes, voice-over narration and television footage to trace Diana’s life. Episode one: Diana’s life pre-royal marriage, her parents, birth, childhood, school years, employment in child care, engagement and marriage to Prince Charles, the rise of her popularity with the press. Episode 2: Ascendency of Diana’s fame and the press’s obsession with her, eclipsing Charles, cracks in the Royal marriage, the affair between Camilla and Charles, Diana’s popularity with the people and common touch. Episode 3: Diana’s affair with James Hewitt, the rival biographies, the Charles and Diana TV interviews, the divorce, Camilla gate, Diana gate, the rival camps and press obsession with the unravelling of the monarchy. Episode 4: Diana’s post-divorce suitors, fame in America, charity work with victims of landmines and AIDS, the press’s hounding of her, her romance with Dodi Al Fayed, death in Paris and subsequent public mourning of her life.

results.title: Passage west. Program 1: A dream of freedom
results.creator_credit: Philip Donnellan, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An examination of the great wave of British emigration to North America in the 19th century, based on historical documents, correspondence of the immigrants, and firsthand interviews with their descendents. A comparison is made with the plight of the modern immigrant.

results.title: Dexter Gordon: more than you know [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Don McGlynn, Leonard Melone and Chase Productions
results.brief_description: Dexter Gordon: more than you know looks at the career of the charismatic, lyrical alto saxophone player - Dexter Gordon. The film includes interviews with Gordon and performances from various periods in his lifetime. As we follow his career we also travel through jazz history, witnessing rare footage and recordings from other jazz greats, like Coleman Hawkins, Lester Young, the Lionel Hampton Orchestra and Billy Eckstine’s Orchestra, Ben Webster, Charlie Parker, Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen and Bud Powell. Don McGlynn also includes interviews with Bernard Tavernier about Gordon’s involvement in the film “Round midnight”, including footage from Dexter Gordon’s screen test for the part for which he was nominated for an Academy Award. This film not only includes some fantastic music, it also gives a wonderful sense of Gordon’s warmth and humour whilst dealing honestly with his use of drugs and his years of exile in Denmark.

results.title: Passing through Sweden
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, John Kemeny, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film critic of one of Sweden’s daily newspapers says of this film by Martin Duckworth, “Never before have I seen a film that so intensely interpreted the experience of Swedish surroundings … an atmosphere film” in which all the expression is in the pictures.

results.title: Passage west. Program 2: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Philip Donnellan, Bill Brind, British Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Program 2 looks at the fortunes and misfortunes of British immigrants to Prince Edward Island, through a re-enactment of their history, letters, diaries, and interviews with their children and grandchildren.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Donnellan, Bill Brind, British Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Devdas
results.creator_credit: Bimal Roy and Bimal Roy Productions
results.brief_description: The setting is pre-independence Bengal - Devdas and Paro are childhood neighbours who grow up together sharing an innocent and joyful friendship, despite their different social status. Whilst still a young man and quite a prankster, Devdas is sent to Calcutta to study and in order to help him mature. He returns home years later a handsome man and Paro has blossomed into a true beauty. Disregarding their mutual love for one another, Devdas’ parents oppose the match, due to Paro’s lowly status, and her parents arrange for her to marry another. Paro is willing to risk all, including her reputation for their love but Devdas, weak and unable to defy his family, cannot, and is driven to despair and alcoholism. Directed by Bimil Roy, this film is lyrical and understated in its evocation of the lovers’ sorrow. Features numerous songs with original music composed by Sachin Dev Burman and lyrics by Sahir Ludhianvi and incandescent black and white cinematography. Starring: Dilip Kumar, Vijantimala and Suchitra Sen. From the novel by Sarat Chandra Chatterjee.

results.title: Passage Out of Paradise
results.brief_description: A thousand miles in an open outrigger canoe, voyaging through some of the most beautiful islands and most treacherous waters on earth! This is the challenge accepted by nine crews from all over the world who gather in Bali to sail through the Indonesian archipelago, across the Timor Sea to Darwin. For crews of young men and women from Australia, U.K., Holland, Germany, France, Japan, U.S.A., New Zealand and Indonesia, it was an adventure that they will never forget.

results.title: Partnership
results.creator_credit: Waldemar Kuri, Karl Gschrey, Otto Martini and Gesellschaft Fur Bildende Filme
results.brief_description: Aid to underdeveloped countries providing food and work for millions. To achieve this end in countries such as India, Pakistan and Egypt, centuries have to be bridged. The main goal is not merely to provide financial aid and material goods but to work in partnership and material goods but to work in partnership and material goods but to work in partnership to develop natural resources and train skilled workers. Examples of projects undertaken include power stations, sugar refineries, cement factories, textile mills, and Rourkela, the largest iron and steel works in Asia.

results.title: Detour
results.creator_credit: Edgar G. Ulmer, Leon Fromkess and PRC Pictures
results.brief_description: When New York pianist Al Roberts (Tom Neal) embarks a transcontinental journey to join his girlfriend in Hollywood, he is overwhelmed by an intricate web of fate and circumstance. After trying to flee the accidental death of a driver who has given him a ride, Al steals the man’s car and his identity and continues towards Los Angeles only to be deterred by Vera (Ann Savage) who knows his secrets and how to exploit them.
